item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Wednesday, January 29, 2025 at 4:20 PM UTC
item.description:
1. DeepSeek proves the future of LLMs is open-source (118 points | 39 comments)
2. OpenAI Furious DeepSeek Might Have Stolen All the Data OpenAI Stole from Us (674 points | 294 comments)
3. Bacteria (and Their Metabolites) and Depression (276 points | 98 comments)
4. A story about restoring and upgrading a Commodore Amiga 1000 (23 points | 4 comments)
5. I still like Sublime Text (632 points | 358 comments)
6. Seagate: 'new' hard drives used for tens of thousands of hours (137 points | 72 comments)
7. New speculative attacks on Apple CPUs (976 points | 324 comments)
8. Preserves: An Expressive Data Language (35 points | 19 comments)
9. X partners with Visa to enable money transfers on the platform (17 points | 22 comments)
10. The ancient discovery that put a Silk Road city back on the map (9 points | discuss)
11. Google Pixel 4a old firmware is gone, trapping users on the buggy battery update (35 points | 17 comments)
12. Adding concurrent read/write to DuckDB with Arrow Flight (40 points | 10 comments)
13. I do not want AI to "polish" me (252 points | 146 comments)
14. Italy's privacy regulator goes after DeepSeek (32 points | 28 comments)
15. Infracost (YC W21) Is Hiring Senior Software Engineers (GMT+2 to GMT-6) ( | hide)
16. Complete hardware and software setup for running Deepseek-R1 locally. ($6000) (52 points | 23 comments)
17. Cali's AG Tells AI Companies Almost Everything They're Doing Might Be Illegal (65 points | 44 comments)
18. Boom XB-1 First Supersonic Flight [video] (648 points | 463 comments)
19. Proof of concept WMI virus (zero-day) (38 points | 8 comments)
20. Composable SQL (229 points | 105 comments)
21. Science YouTuber physicsgirl (Dianna Cowern) stands for the first time in 2 yrs (555 points | 187 comments)
22. IAC confirms existence of a Super-earth in the habitable zone of a Sun-like Star (391 points | 255 comments)
23. What's OAuth2, anyway? (282 points | 70 comments)
24. Jevons paradox (122 points | 96 comments)
25. Meta's Mark Zuckerberg explores purchase of Washington DC property (37 points | 19 comments)
26. We got hit by an alarmingly well-prepared phish spammer (118 points | 72 comments)
27. Cardan Grille (10 points | discuss)
28. Maxima in the browser using Embedded Common Lisp on WASM (234 points | 48 comments)
29. Our phones are killing our ability to feel sexy (2024) (146 points | 134 comments)
30. Malimite – iOS and macOS Decompiler (207 points | 27 comments)
